articles.description: The Kremlin's hacking misdirection is evolving. And even when those attempts to confuse forensics fail, they still succeed at sowing future doubt.
articles.title: Russia's Olympics Hack Was the Country's Latest False Flag Attack
articles.author: Andy Greenberg

articles.description: After an uproar over how much Trump and Clinton paid for Facebook ads during the 2016 presidential campaign, the social network has shared some—but not all—numbers.
articles.title: What Facebook Isn't Saying About Trump and Clinton's Campaign Ads

articles.description: The United States high court will decide whether a US warrant extends to digital data stored overseas.
articles.title: The US v. Microsoft Supreme Court Case Has Big Implications for Data

articles.description: President Trump plans to name Brad Parscale, the digital director of his 2016 campaign, to run his re-election bid, according to the Drudge Report.
articles.title: The man behind Trump’s Facebook campaign strategy will reportedly run his 2020 campaign
articles.author: Colin Lecher

articles.description: The warrantless surveillance law gained attention in 2013 when Edward Snowden leaked that the NSA was using it to spy on Americans’ text messages, phone calls, emails and internet activity — all legally, and without warrants. That bill has been passed by the …
articles.title: Warrantless surveillance law proves it’s time to take privacy into our own hands
articles.author: David Gorodyansky

articles.description: The second Michael O’Rielly took the stage at CPAC and told people who they should vote for, ethics watchdogs say he broke a federal law. But in an administration that has regularly thumbed its nose at ethics rules, it’s hard to imagine anyone will care. Read…
articles.title: Experts Say an FCC Official Broke the Law to Help Trump. Trump Alone Will Decide If He's Punished.
articles.author: Dell Cameron

articles.description: Presidential son-in-law Jared Kushner will no longer get access to the nation’s most sensitive intelligence secrets, a circumstance that’s sure to complicate his role as America’s Middle East peace-broker. Read more...
articles.title: Jared Kushner, America's Middle East Negotiator, Loses Access to Top-Secret Intelligence
articles.author: Dell Cameron

articles.description: Federal agents recently arrested an undocumented immigrant from Ivory Coast as he left Bronx Criminal Court, part of stepped-up enforcement by the Trump administration.

articles.description: The president’s adviser and son-in-law lost his top-secret clearance, a White House official and another person familiar with Mr. Kushner’s situation said.
articles.title: Jared Kushner’s Security Clearance Downgraded
